==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=𣸁,𦪉}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|水|c1=s|t1=water|𦘔|c2=p|ls=psc}} – a ferry crossing. {{och-l|𦘔}} has been simplified into the unrelated {{och-l|聿}} in the clerical script.

===Etymology===
From {{och-l|濟|to ferry|id=2}} + nominal suffix ''*-n'' ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

|m=jīn
|c=zeon1

|mn_note=(excluding Zhangzhou) tin - vernacular; chin - literary
|w=1jin
|mc=y

}}
